metadata.title: CVE-2022-1629 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Buffer Over-read in function find_next_quote in GitHub repository vim/vimprior to 8.2.4925. This vulnerabilities are capable of crashing software,Modify Memory, and possible remote execution

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1629` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

vim - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.5
vim-athena - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.5
vim-common - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.5
vim-gtk - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.5
vim-gtk3 - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.5
vim-gui-common - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.5
vim-nox - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.5
vim-runtime - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.5
vim-tiny - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.5
xxd - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: vim package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.5').
